Bodhisattva Huifa addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One, after the Buddha's nirvana, there will be five chaotic periods.
First, the people will be in chaos.
Second, the king's way will be in chaos.
Third, the ghosts and spirits will be in chaos.
Fourth, the people's hearts will be in chaos with worry and fear.
Fifth, the Dharma will be in chaos.
At that time, the four types of disciples will use the Dharma.
How can they attain liberation from the world?
The Buddha told Huifa:
At that time, the disciples of the four groups
will all have weak determination and weak precepts.
They will not guard the sense doors and let the six sense faculties run wild.

The rich follow the rich.
The pure follow the pure in their conduct.
Their minds do not dwell in the Way, and their mouths speak idle words.
Their minds are confused by desires, and they are followed by a crowd of troubles.
Their words and actions contradict each other.
After death, they go to the palace of Mount Tai.

They want to repent but are unwilling to listen.
